description.narrative:
13 January 2018- a phreatic eruption at 5:06 P.M was reported producing 2.5 kilometers high grayish ash plume drifted towards the Southwest. Based on the seismic records, the eruption lasted for 1 hour and 47 minutes.
14 January 2018- The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology (PHIVOLCS) raised Mayon Alert Level 1 (abnormal) to Alert Level 2 (increasing unrest) at 0030H (12:30 AM). Another phreatic eruption occurred on 1143H (11:43 AM) resulting to raise Alert Level 3 (increased tendency towards hazardous eruption). At this level, magma is at the crater and a hazardous eruption is possible within weeks or days. Preparation for the evacuation of the residents in the 6-Km permanent danger zone were undertaken.
16 January 2018– Albay has been placed under a state of calamity amid the threat of the Mayon Volcano's hazardous eruption.
The Phreatic eruption resulted to produce grayish ash plumes towards the Southwest. Traces of ashfall were found in the municipalities of Guinobatan, Camalig, Daraga and Ligao City. The people from the municipalities of Malilipot and Sto Domingo and the Cities of Tabaco and Legazpe were also affect bring a total of 8 cities and municipalities (36 barangays) from the province of Albay to almost 39,000 affected persons (9,480 families). 87% of these affected families are currently staying in 30 evacuation centers while the rest of the affected families are staying outside evacuation centers as of 17 January 2:A.M. data of the Department of Social Welfare and Development. The number of affected families is expected to increase in the coming days if the Mayon Volcano activity Alert Level will not be downgraded.
Distribution of 600 bed kits - each with 2 blankets, 1 mosquito net, 1 mat
